Begin Boost to C++ Standard Library migration

Replace commonly used Boost components with C++ standard library equivalents:

Smart Pointers:
- boost::shared_ptr -> std::shared_ptr
- boost::weak_ptr -> std::weak_ptr  
- boost::make_shared -> std::make_shared
- boost::dynamic_pointer_cast -> std::dynamic_pointer_cast

Threading:
- boost::mutex -> std::mutex
- boost::lock_guard -> std::lock_guard
- boost::function -> std::function
- boost::ref/cref -> std::ref/cref

Containers and Utilities:
- boost::unordered_set -> std::unordered_set
- boost::hash -> std::hash
- BOOST_ASSERT -> assert

Type Traits \(partial\):
- boost::mpl::false_ -> std::false_type
- boost::mpl::true_ -> std::true_type
- boost::is_integral -> std::is_integral
- boost::enable_if -> std::enable_if \(with ::value\)

- Boost.Graph \(for routing algorithms\)
- Boost.Intrusive \(for message queues\)
- Boost.Pool \(for memory pooling\)
- Boost.Parameter \(for named parameters\)
- boost::function_traits \(no std equivalent\)
- boost::mpl \(partial usage remains\)
